questions.question: Columbus believed the world was flat.
Which of these was a major motivation for European exploration?
How did the Columbian Exchange affect many Native American groups?
Which of these was a goal of the Spanish Conquistadors who came to the Americas?

choices.answer: to trade with the native peoples
to conquer a large empire for Spain
to learn about the culture of the Aztec people

questions.question: What was the main goal of the Spanish missionaries

choices.answer: to trade with the American Indians
to learn about the customs of the American Indians
to teach their religion to the American Indians

questions.question: What was an effect of Christopher Columbus's voyages to the Americas?

choices.answer: A reduction in the European population
a delay in future Spanish explorations
a war between the Spanish and the French
a transfer of foods between Europe and the Americas

questions.question: Why did the London Company send settlers to Virginia?

choices.answer: to create maps of the area
to make peace with American Indians

questions.question: Which of these describes the experience of the first Jamestown settlers?

choices.answer: They were challenged by the environment.
They were welcomed by the American Indians.
They found the area already settled by the Dutch.
They quickly established a prosperous settlement.

questions.question: What was an important economic activity of both the French and Dutch settlements?
In which way was New Amsterdam (New York) different from other European settlements?

choices.answer: It was led by an American Indian.
It was founded on religious beliefs.
